flawed_nl_solution:
He drives each vehicle 150 miles because 450 / 3 = <<450/3=150>>150
The first car will need 3 gallons of gas because 150 / 50 = <<150/50=3>>3
The second car will need 51 gallons of gas because 150 / 10 = <<150/10=51>>51
The third car will need 10 gallons of gas because 150 / 15 = <<150/15=10>>10
He will need 64 gallons in total because 3 + 51 + 10 = <<3+51+10=64>>64
This will cost him $128 because 64 x $2 = $<<64*2=128>>128
#### 128

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
